intro: Cyphomattia korshinskyi, commonly known as the Korshinsky's cyphomattia, is a rare and distinctive plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its unique, palmate leaves and showy, pentagonal flowers that are often pink or purple in color. It thrives in high-altitude environments, typically in rocky or humid mountainous areas. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
